sentence.text: ` Those working with the Germans were no less guilty of the most horrible brutality than the Titoists . "

He ca n't complain about people not liking him when he 's so horrible to them .
I could n't send her away thinking I could be so heartless and horrible , but I also knew that I was n't going to go home that weekend ; I 'd find an excuse .

She 's not too nice , she 's not too horrible .
She wanted to cry , but it was too horrible for crying .

` Go home , you horrible child , " said another woman .
Just you get your horrible child seen to , Mrs Day , that 's the only advice I can give you . "
I tried to tell her about the horrible man on the doorstep but she would n't listen .
I could n't get married to a horrible old man like Buffalo !
He is a rude horrible selfish man , I quite see that , but I like him personally , if you can understand that .
Timothy Gedge was a horrible sort of person , talking about honeymoons like that , saying Kate 's mother was peachy .
" He 's a horrible person , " Kate cried with renewed vehemence , and looked behind her as if contemplating a continuation of her assault .
" Oh , for God 's sake , stop saying he 's a horrible person ! "
It must be horrible to be driven away from all your old haunts because you might bump into your drug mates .
` It is horrible to think of what happened to that poor , poor family . "
It was horrible to be called boring .
A woman , someone like Irene , I know , would have found him horrible to be near .
Ca n't you see how horrible he is ?

What is best for father and child may be perfectly horrible for the mother .

Jenny 's horrible to me .

I was confined to my room , terrorized by the most horrible threats , cruelly ill-used to break my spirit - see this stab on my shoulder and the bruises from end to end of my arms - and a gag was thrust into my mouth on the one occasion when I tried to call from the window .
